knimeNode.name: NetNGlyc@Nectar
knimeNode.shortDescription: Provides a KNIME interface to glycosylation predictions via CBS' algorithms

intro.p: Uses a local server in the Nectar Research cloud to provide much improved throughput compared to the CBS server in Denmark. This server provides access to v1.0 of NetNGlyc. Please note that this service is intended for mammalian systems (esp. human) and results may be unpredictable for other species.

Note: this node is only workable for University of Melbourne staff/students and collaborators as it uses a server only accessible from on-campus. To use this node you will need a working Internet connection to the NECTAR eResearch cloud.

fullDescription.option: the input must column a protein sequence column (eg. as created by the FASTA Reader), choose the column here

ports.inPort: Input table with a protein sequence column
ports.outPort: Predictions of glycosylation sites from NetNGlyc
